Believing that the closer decisions are made to us the people the better decisions will be made. I believed in a strong smart military. Republicans believed in a strong NATO and relationship with out Allies. Republicans believed that Russia China South Korea and Iran were our enemies. Republicans believed in Free trade. Republicans believed in sensible gun control. Reagan instituted the first gun control on automatic weapons. Reagan revered the FBI and Justice Department and all law enforcement.  By all these measures Donald Trump is not a Republican. He has bloated the Federal Budget and taken power from the states He disrespects the military and has weakened there moral and readiness. He has cozied up to China North Korea and Russia while considering leaving NATO and angering our allies He has instituted Tariffs on many countries destroying free trade. He has torn up trade contracts without replacing them with anything. He has bowed to the NRA and won't even discuss sensible gun control. Donald Trump has disparaged the FBI and Justice department destroying there morale.  If you support Donald Trump you can not also claim to be a Republican. Ronald Reagan would disagree with almost every policy of Donald Trump as Have George HW Bush George Bush John Boehner Michael Steele and many many other traditional Republicans.  If you support Donald Trump that is your right but DO NOT call yourself a Republican as you are going against every Republican principal of the last 40 years

Where to start even if we already know everything if we are so smart that we have it all figured out we are Americans after all we are exceptional in so many ways that we don't know what to do with ourselves and with all these brains that we have. We act as if doubting the facts makes us look smarter and more knowledgeable. Maybe we in our own small community don't look so bad but the people without may think we have lost our faculties oh BTW the world is laughing at us already. POLITICS!!  I was visiting with my cousin one day during my campaign last cycle and she asked ew what is your thing with politics almost like I had told her I was going to become a snake handler. She sounded as though politics had nothing to do with her life and a person could simply choose to stay out of politics.  Politics is a part of everything we do. As an example there was a time when all of our groceries were individually marked with the price on the can or box or whatever. But then the Grocers Association fought to make it so that is no longer the case. If the bar code is on the product and the price is clearly marked on the shelf then the item doesnt need to be individually marked. In the bigger stores there are often times scanning devices placed strategically throughout the store that allow the customer to read the bar code and find out the price. Im not arguing for or against this process just saying grocery shopping is affected by politics.  I have been a news junky since I got satellite television in the late 80s. Before that I was fascinated by the occasional story that was on all the networks. I lived in rural areas of Rhodes Bentley and Standish since 1982 where there is no cable areas without great inexpensive internet. This is politics..  I worked for the Department of Health and Human Services for 22 years. During that time our name changed 3 times shortly after I retired it changed again. Politics. Working for the department gave me first hand knowledge of the inner workings of the government and politics and its affect on the people I served. I was a Childrens Protective Services worker and a familys and childrens advocate by trade. I grew up in a union family so I knew the importance of unions but in my work I became a union member and a union activist. Politics.  The other day I posted an ad regarding veteran and service member suicide in response to President Trumps alleged comments about those who have sacrificed so much for our country. I got called out very politely about making veteran suicide political. Veteran suicide is political. To not address veteran suicide as political would be negligent. I have been a supporter of veterans services since I was a young army wife myself in the early 70s.  In the aftermath of the dam failures in early May I addressed that as a political issue. There is nothing more political than the responsibility to keep people and their property safe. As your state legislator if you called my office and said I live in an area that is threatened by an unsafe dam with thousands of other families and children I would have done something! I would have pressured the agencies responsible with no regard to party or my own comfort level. I would have put it all on the line just like I did for all the vulnerable children and adults I served every day for 22 years. I may appear mild and meek on the outside but in a battle I am a fighter!

As Bruce's primary opponent continues to attack him yesterday Fred Doucette posted a piece to his Facebook page about next week's EC3 primary. It is worth a read - see below.  "As the September 8th primary approaches Im following the District 3 Executive Council race closely. With Russell Prescott retiring this year several Republicans are seeking to succeed him. As people know I like and support Bruce Crochetiere. But as Ive watched their campaigns Janet Stevens has stood out  for all the wrong reasons. Not only has she been attacking Bruce but in her campaign materials she claims she will deliver conservative leadership on day one. Time to set the record straight on what being a conservative means to Stevens.  For Stevens being conservative meant supporting John Kasich during the 2016 presidential primary. The same John Kasich who spent the last few years increasingly opposed to the Second Amendment and protections for lawful gun owners. The same John Kasich who has gone on to become a CNN contributor and one of President Trumps fiercest critics. The same John Kasich that joined Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer in calling for President Trump to be impeached.  But that was our February 2016 presidential primary and there were many choices for President so maybe Stevens then proudly stood with President Trump after he secured the nomination. Right? Wrong. As recently reported by NH Journal in July 2016 as Republicans were nominating Donald Trump Stevens said of Kasich in a newspaper article Im hanging in there for 2020. Were waiting with open arms. Waiting with open arms for 2020  for John Kasich? She must have hoped either that President Trump would lose or that Kasich would primary him. Fortunately neither of those things happened.  But that was later in 2016 so maybe Stevens positions on Trump evolved after he was elected. Right? Wrong. Less than two years ago in November 2018 NH Public Radio did a story on a potential Kasich run for President in 2020  either to primary President Trump or as a third party. Janet Stevens was quoted in that story as an example of a voter who would be attracted to a Kasich 2020 candidacy. In the story Stevens described herself as a moderate centrist Republican  whoa hold on a second. She describes herself as a moderate centrist less than two years ago? In the context of supporting a fellow centrist like Kasich against President Trump in 2020? How does that square with delivering conservative leadership? It doesnt.  But that was November 2018 so maybe Stevens stood with the President in our 2020 presidential primary. Right? Wrong. While John Kasich chose a cushy CNN role over challenging our President someone else even more liberal decided to challenge President Trump in our 2020 presidential primary  former Massachusetts Governor Bill Weld. The same Bill Weld who endorsed Barack Obama in 2008 and left the Republican Party a few years ago to run against Donald Trump in the general election. Weld is a dream Republican - pro-gun control pro-amnesty  if youre a Democrat.  In September 2019  just one year ago - Janet Stevens was announced as a member of Governor Bill Welds New Hampshire Leadership Team. Bill. Weld. Conservative move by Janet Stevens? Hardly.  While President Trump took on China Janet Stevens waited with open arms for John Kasich.  While President Trump nominated conservative judges Janet Stevens described herself as a moderate centrist and hoped for a Kasich run against President Trump in 2020.  While President Trump lowered taxes cut regulations and was attacked every day by liberal Democrats during a ridiculous impeachment process Janet Stevens stood with liberal Bill Weld against Donald Trump in our New Hampshire presidential primary.  So now  with the Executive Council primary around the corner  the Janet Stevens that supported John Kasich in the 2016 primary. The Janet Stevens that waited with open arms for Kasich in the summer of 2016 after the primary. The Janet Stevens that described herself as a moderate centrist in 2018 while hoping for a Kasich 2020 campaign. The Janet Stevens that was publicly announced as a member of liberal Bill Welds New Hampshire leadership team in 2019. And the Janet Stevens that got an F grade from the New Hampshire Firearms Coalition recently on 2A. Thats the Janet Stevens that now promises conservative leadership if elected?  I dont think so.  Bruce Crochetiere is a strong conservative we can trust.  Janet Stevens  who backed Bill Weld over President Trump and who waited with open arms for John Kasich the man who just spoke on behalf of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris at the Democrat convention - clearly is not.  The last thing we need to do is send a Weld/Kasich moderate centrist like Janet Stevens to Concord."  Fred Doucette State Representative Asst. Republican Floor Leader Ways & Means Committee 2016 & 2020 New Hampshire Co-Chair Donald Trump for President

Joshua Ehrhart Career Interview  Joshua Ehrhart is an intelligent compassionate and multi-talented individual and also a good friend of mine. We met as kids at Synagogue and JCC and then over the years we sort of lost touch until we reconnected in Los Angeles when we were both living there. Joshua still lives and works in Hollywood. Please enjoy the interview!  What is the name of your position and company/organization?  Ehrhart Productions. Music Producer Artist Recording Engineer and Instrumentalist (mainly keyboards and I teach piano too.) Also Owner President and CEO.  Can you give a brief description of the work you are doing?  I work with clients on producing projects and I also work with other producers and assist them with their projects as well. That includes instrumental arranging mixing and vocal recording.  How did you get into this line of work?  I went to music school and studied audio engineering. You don't have to go but I recommend going. Knowing how to play piano and music theory is really helpful and also spending time getting good at recording. I recommend taking some audio engineering classes to get started and then practicing on your own by recording your own music. Record friends or amateur musicians and don't charge at first just practice to get good. If you enjoy it you're not doing it solely for the money. People will start hearing you and you can slowly start charging and raising your rates. Also you're going to want to start off with a simple recording setup at first and then as you get money from clients you can put that money into upgrading.  What does a day of work look like?  Hopefully it's booked with clients and hopefully your own projects. Most clients don't like to record in the morning so record yourself in the morning and hopefully later in the day you'll have paid clients and you can also work on promotion.  How do you get and stay mentally prepared/fit for work and your workday?  Mentally you've got to love what you do. If you don't love music you're better off doing something else that you love. Music and sound should inspire you as well as the people you're working with.  What has been the greatest challenge in your career?  Promoting and monetizing my talents. I'm kind of a quiet and shy person naturally and not a big talker so therefore I don't promote as much as I probably should. Some people are good at talking themselves up and I just prefer work but sometimes you've got to promote to get that work. The Donald Trump type personality tends to be very successful in the music and entertainment business.  What has been the greatest success or accomplishment in your career?  When I first started a lot of people told me I wasn't good at music that I couldn't learn to record that I couldn't learn to sing or wasn't capable of making money or making music. I hope that I have disproved that.  What elements of your workplace do you appreciate?  My recording studio is in my living room so I can create almost any time of the day that I want to. I don't have to rent a recording studio every time I want to work I can just do it on my own time.  What do you do to balance your work life with your personal life?  I try my best to keep regular business hours. I also try to work six days a week and no late night recording sessions unless someone's paying me a lot of money to do them.  What do you do after a stressful workday to relax?  I'll either hang out with friends or cook some good vegan food and watch a thriller on Netflix or all of the above.  Where do you see the future of your career going?  I'm going to be focused more on my solo artists and solo work and also a few collaborations I have in the works as well. I'm currently working on a song about the coronavirus it's called The Virus.  What advice would you give to a job applicant seeking work?  Learn to do it on your own. Then you won't have to apply. Learn as much as you can and get your own setup going. Learn many different ways. Go to school watch videos read books.  What is the most important general career advice you would give?  Choose something that you love and work hard at it. Don't think you can have too much education. Education is a good thing. Don't think you're better than anybody else just learn as much as you can.  Thanks Joshua!  #careerinterview #career #interview #careers #music #musiccareer #musiccareers #musicjob #musicjobs #musicalartist #musicproducer #audioengineer #instrumentalist #client #clients #marketing #promotion #selfemployed #education #piano #musictheory #musicproduction #audioengineering #ehrhart #joshuaehrhart #ehrhartproductions

They know viewers follow his example and thus it will now be impossible to convince many people social distancing/masks are important. Bc Trump has made it crystal clear they AREN'T.  4/ And they KNOW that masks/social distancing have proven to save lives (see the NIH Director below).  So for no good reason they chose a path that will make it harder to beat COVID and would lead to more people dying. They made this choice consciously.  5/ Think of it this way - say you told your wife you're going to drive to the grocery store and on the way ignore all the stoplights.  You don't have a good reason - you just want to get to the store faster. She tells you before you leave that you're going to get people killed.  6/ But you do it anyway and you run over people.  You had no good reason to be reckless. You knew the consequences beforehand and did it anyway.  You'd be rightly called a killer.  The difference btwn you and Trump is that you killed 3 or 4. Trump's actions killed thousands.  ======= End of Thread From Senator Chris Murphy via Twitter  184000+ have now died from COVID-19 in the United States and that number will assuredly increase substantially. On the surface it seems rather senseless and it is hard to see how anyone benefits from it. But let's look deeper.  When a cult-leader takes glory in requiring his followers to risk perishing senselessly on his behalf and when cult members are quite vocal in defending their freedom to infect and kill others it is a death cult.  It is tempting to make a joke about it as Darwinism in action. Some of them like Herman Cain will be gone and the pandemic will likely impact Trump's base harder than others.  But the willingness to potentially sacrifice themselves and the willingness to inflict senseless death upon others becomes a bond that actually brings them closer together. It proves their loyalty to the cult (most specifically the cult leader) is greater than their sense of right or wrong or even of reason. It is how a cult leader gets people to drink poisoned Kool-Aid. (If using the term "cult" makes you uncomfortable you might find the mafia syndicate analogy more apt. He is putting them through a right of passage that binds them as soldatos in his Cosa Nostra with Trump of course as The Don.)  It also seems right out of the Twilight Zone that once America's men (and women) in uniform like my father served in the armed services (and in some cases died) to oppose fascism during World War II while Trump's supporters today appear to be willing to sacrifice their lives in support of bringing fascism to America. It feels prima facie treasonous.  Fascist Germany was a death cult too and Trump is using the pandemic as an opportunity to apply the same general template to America. Think about the Nazis who participated in the mass murder of millions in Germany in the 1930s and 1940s. The people who committed those horrific acts in most cases started out as decent and moral members of German society just like your Trump-supporting neighbors once were decent and moral members of American society. But under the culture of fascist Germany led by a genocidal authoritarian the normal societal safeguards that prevent such atrocities were removed. Behaviors that had once been considered unacceptable or even insane for a single individual to engage in became "accepted" when conducted en masse by many thousands of people who were bound together by their willingness to commit horrific acts and by their allegiance to their cult leader. During the final weeks of the Third Reich and the war in Europe many civilians government officials and military personnel throughout Germany also committed suicide. In addition to high-ranking Nazi officials like Adolf Hitler Joseph Goebbels Heinrich Himmler Philipp Bouhler and Martin Bormann many others chose Selbstmord (German for "suicide" literally "Self-murder") (Ref: Wikipedia).  Trump couldn't care one way or another if his followers live or die as individuals. To him they are all marks. But he thrives on their willingness to die for him and to kill for him. The loss of support he might incur because of some thinning of the herd is far less important to him than the value and cohesiveness he gets from bonding the group together to support him in a manner that goes beyond rationality to become something more akin to idolization or worship.  Watching these individuals self-sacrifice would be bad enough if it would only end there. There is a price to be paid for an exceptional degree of stupidity and gullibility. But when these cult warriors get infected they in turn risk the lives of health care workers and many others who provide essential services to them. And they infect their children and their children will then infect the children of others along with their teachers. Consider a 60+ year-old school teacher with asthma who is told (by her governor and her school district following direction from Trump) that she has no choice but to either go to work in a classroom and then incur a high likelihood of COVID-19 infection and then a subsequent high likelihood of an adverse outcome (death) from the infection... or she can resign her job and lose her income and her ability to pay her bills. It isn't the kind of choice that any human being should ever have to make.  Crime analyst Jeff Asher looked at US crime trends in 2020 and found murders are up 26 percent trending up in 19 of 25 cities included in his analysis (and reported by Vox). Under Trump's watch hate crimes in the US reached a 16 year high in 2018 (the last year in which comprehensive statistics have been released) according to the US Department of Justice. The apparent increased volume of hate crime reports in the recent news implies a strong likelihood they have continued to escalate further since then. Once individuals cross a line into a willingness to senselessly kill others for the cult leader they won't hesitate to do other dreadful things like destroy ballots take to the streets to incite violence with peaceful protesters and engage in a wide variety of other wrongful acts designed to create chaos that "only he can fix."  But the reality is that the only ones who can fix it are you and I this November.  The alternative is simply too dreadful to abide.
